verses.roman:
teṣu kāle vyajāyanta
racitāvayavā hareḥ
śaktibhir durvibhāvyābhiḥ
komalāṅga-tanūruhāḥ

synonyms: teṣu—from those eggs; kāle—in time; vyajāyanta—were born; racita—produced; avayavāḥ—(children) whose limbs; hareḥ—of the Supreme Lord, Hari; śaktibhiḥ—by the potencies; durvibhāvyābhiḥ—which are inconceivable; komala—tender; aṅga—whose limbs; tanūruhāḥ—and feathers.
translation: When the time was ripe, baby pigeons, with tender limbs and feathers created by the inconceivable potencies of the Lord, were born from those eggs.
